revised_title: An Investigation of Tides and Barometric Irregularities on the Coasts of Ireland
tldr: The author analyzes a series of observations on the tides and barometric irregularities along the coast of Ireland, finding that the mean height of the sea is greater around the northern half of the island and that irregularities in water height are nearly the same in magnitude and sign across the coast. The author also examines the relationship between these irregularities and wind patterns, as well as the connection with barometric readings.
